result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.     
Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, with credit of 2 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  
- Maintain full time employment and/or school.
- Perform 30 hours of community service.
- Parenting classes.
- Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court with attorney Thomas Hackbart.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing in court, court VACATED Bench Warrant. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request defense.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Morgan Willz supervsied by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failed to appear. Court issued, but STAYED a bench warrant. Case adjourend to branch 23 for a Calendar Call Date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Attorney Hackbart recently appointed to case and unable to appear in court.  Case adjourned for status conference.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Attorney Liggins informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a plea and status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.
  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store

Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Vincent Lamont Luckett Jr
Current: 3920 E Layton Ave., Upper, Cudahy, WI 53110 United States  (Effective: 04-22-2015)
Prior: 3526 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Luckett not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/5/15 @ 1 PM
